frame.name: Chaos
frame.definition: <def-root>The lexical units in this frame have to do with an <fen>Entity</fen> being in a <fen>State</fen> of order or disorder. Often the <fen>Entity</fen> is unexpressed in this frame and is, therefore, marked as a null instantiation. <ex></ex> <ex>Soon <fex name="Ent">the system</fex> was <m>in</m> <fex name="Degree">total</fex> <t><fex name="St">chaos</fex></t>.</ex> <ex></ex> <ex>Fifa had already fined the Brazilians a minor sum for <fex name="Ent">crowd</fex> <t><fex name="St">disorder</fex></t>.</ex> <ex></ex> <ex>He had a hammer and banged it against the walls to restore <t><fex name="St">order</fex></t> but nobody took any notice of him. <fex name="Ent">INI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The object or phenomenon which exists in the <fen>State</fen> of disorder. It is common for the <fen>Entity</fen> to be null instantiated in this frame.
<ex>Subsequent bomb alerts caused <fex name="Ent">travel</fex><t>chaos</t> in the London Underground.</ex>
<ex>Get the treaty signed before there's time for any more <t>chaos</t>.<fex name="Ent">INI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: State
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>State</fen> in which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists. Usually the <fen>State</fen> will be the target-denoting noun.
<ex>More <t><fex name="St">chaos</fex></t> awaits the Soviet Union unless it ditches perestroika for a Thatcherite purge of its economy.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>State</fen> exists.
<ex>Booking, reservations, staffing and just about everything was in a state of <fex name="Deg">total</fex> <t>chaos</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> exists in the <fen>State</fen>.
<ex>Lying in bed listening to the <t>chaos</t> <fex name="P">downstairs</fex>, he knew his conquest had only been temporary.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of time in which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists in the <fen>State</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists in the <fen>State</fen>.
<ex>Monica Lewinksy in 1998 gave him a rich new target, as did the electoral <t>chaos</t> <fex name="T">of 2000</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any characterization of the <fen>State</fen> not covered by a more specific frame element.
<ex>Let him picture her pottering in the <fex name="Des">improvised</fex> <t>chaos</t> of a damp, windowless room.</ex>
</def-root>

lexUnit.name: disorder.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of chaos or confusion

lexUnit.name: order.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of non-confusion; the opposite of chaos

lexUnit.name: riot.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a noisy, violent public disorder caused by a mob of people
